DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Potassium Electrolytes Outcome Upper Limit Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric value representing the highest normal result in the range of values for a laboratory test measuring potassium in blood serum used to comparatively reference patient lab results.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for potassium electrolytes, substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids and are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol K, atomic number 19, and atomic weight 39.10.:(eh-LEK-tro-lites) Substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids or water.  Some examples are sodium, potassium, chloride, and calcium.  Electrolytes are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol K, atomic number 19, and atomic weight 39.10.

Substances that ionize into anions and cations in body fluids.  Electrolytes regulate nerve and muscle function and water distribution between cells, plasma, and interstitial fluid.  Imbalances can cause serious physiologic effects, including seizures, cardiac arrhythmias and convulsions.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Potassium Lab Upper Limit Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value representing the highest normal result in the range of values for a laboratory test measuring potassium in the serum portion of peripheral blood.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changes for initial use on protocol; revised definition and Short name for release for general use
